doc.after: A resident of Kolkata is referred to via the demonym Calcuttan or Kolkatan.[93][94] According to provisional results of the 2011 national census, Kolkata district, which occupies an area of 185Â km2 (71Â sqÂ mi), had a population of 4,486,679;[10] its population density was 24,252/km2 (62,810/sqÂ mi).[10] This represents a decline of 1.88% during the decade 2001â11. The sex ratio is 899Â females per 1000Â malesâlower than the national average.[95] The ratio is depressed by the influx of working males from surrounding rural areas, from the rest of West Bengal, and from neighbouring states, mainly Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, and Orissa; these men commonly leave their families behind.[96] Kolkata's literacy rate of 87.14%[95] exceeds the all-India average of 74%.[97] The urban agglomeration had a population of 14,112,536 in 2011.[11]
